data.title: Love  this hotel
data.text: I love this hotel Santa Anita Inn  is a little out dated but when you are there you feel like you are at a country inn and they keep it clean house keeping comes every other day the surroundings are beautiful you get a patio with a table and chairs the view of the grounds and pool are beautiful listening to the water fall is tranquil and relaxing they have a continental breakfast just muffins, bagels,cereal,fruit and coffee the staff is very nice checking in is fast (but please make reservations) the race track is across the street and also a park the mall in is about 1to2 miles away and any food you would like is in the area .  Overall a very good stay.

data.title: Basic...Quiet...Affordable...
data.text:
The Santa Anita Inn is very near the Westfield Shopping Mall, Santa Anita Race Track as well as other local shopping and restaurants.  As in line with the other reviews on this property, it could stand a great deal of updating.

During breakfast the staffer had to keep coming into the dining room to "hit" the coffee maker on each side just to get it to work. The complimentary breakfast included choice of, coffee, juice, cold cereal toast and pastries. This is good if you're on a budget(which I was).

Our room was near the rear of the property and was very quiet. I particularly liked the small "patio" space just outside the sliding glass doors at the back side of the room which faced the swimming pool. You could eat here, chat or just sit and read. The room was clean, but just old with a small bit of damage. 

The armoire where the television and clothing storage was located must have been recently painted. When I placed my bag on the "closet portion" wet paint was stuck on the bottom of my new travel bag. We had a problem with a lamp late one evening, but the staff was very prompt, kind and accommodating.

Over all we  had a very enjoyable stay. The only suggestion is that the owners invest in the general upgrading of the property.

data.title: Basic No Frills Budget Hotel Near Pasadena
data.text: Hotel room was in need of TLC - especially the bathroom, peeling wall paper, water damaged door, caulking issues.  Relatively quiet, even facing the main street - may have been because of few guests.  Thermostat - old knob style - worked, but you could feel the humidity in the air. Refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer in room.  Pool - looked large enough, but did not use.  Free WIFI - spotty though and teens were frustrated.  Free continental breakfast - small pastries, couple of cereals, bananas, OJ, milk, coffee/tea. Phone in room not working - and they deducted $ for each night ahead of time - appreciated this gesture. Ants in bathroom, daddy long leg spider, and a couple of big red ant-looking winged bugs - but these did not bother us.  Bedding was clean - towels are thin, usable, rough.  Reception is 24/7 - appreciated this - always friendly and helpful - needed toiletry items late in the day, and extra towels because room was not ready, and they keep all these items stocked. Near to freeways, huge mall with theatre just down the road.  Lots of little restaurants and services along the main road which is sits, as well as a hospital.  A very basic motor inn - a place to put your head, and keep expenses really low when visiting nearby Hollywood - especially when hotel prices in nearby Burbank were triple in price. .

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: Okay so it's not the most up-to date property I can not even argue that point. But the hotel is walking distance to the Santa Anita Race Track and the Westfield Mall. So convenient is an understatement.  The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly staff. The breakfast is not so good but you're close Le Roys Restaurant so you'd be an idiot for not going there and trying their breakfast burrito.

data.title: Large Motel
data.text: The Motel is very close to Hwy 210 easily found by taking the turn off for Santa Anita Race track, which is directly opposite. The motel is set in grounds with a swimming pool in the centre. The public areas are clean and pleasant, the room blocks not so nice. Our room was large, newly carpeted and had some refurbishment. It was reasonably clean but the shower curtain was dirty as were some other areas. The breakfast was adequate, cereal, bananas, bread and buns.

data.title: Terrific value in a rundown hotel with beautiful trees and garden
data.text: This one time elegant hotel is scheduled to be razed, a 4 star hotel will be built here.  My room was clean and comfortable.  Room prices are cheap for the area, so the value is very high.  I hope that some of the landscaping will be retained.  In the meantime, the hot tub and pool are not heated, the Wifi is spotty, the Continental breakfast is now very limited, and all the rooms are noisy, lacking modern soundproofing.  That said, I'd stay there again.  Plenty of free parking, and very close for eating and shopping on any budget.  No longer a Chinese maternity hotel.  Along with some rental cars, old trucks, and family sedans, there was a Bentley, a Porsche, and Audi or two, and a few Mercedes in the parking lots.

data.title: Wish the rooms were as nice as the grounds.
data.text: If the chance comes up again, I will probably stay here again. The staff, lobby, location and the grounds were lovely...the room, not so much. The room I stayed in just needs a complete overhaul, especially the bathroom. The bathroom is dated with water damage. Too bad, this place must have been nice 20 years ago. Please update!!! This place is worth it!

data.title: A maternity hotel!
data.text: I didn't realize that this hotel was used by many Chinese tourists as a "maternity" hotel until I stayed there for a few days. In fact, I later learned about this from a news broadcast by a local TV station. The place felt like a Chinatown. Most guests were Chinese and were pregnant! The come here because there's a hospital nearby. The rooms smelled strange and weren't clean. The TV didn't work properly. The garden wasn't kept clean either. The same story goes with the pool. Yurk! The hotel is owned by Chinese too. I've been to some hostels that are cleaner than this hotel. It's very unfortunate because this hotel used to be great under the previous ownership.

data.title: Better than average budget option
data.text:
We stayed here for it's proximity to colleges we were touring and the price.  It is also close to the freeway and a Westfield mall, with a plethora of dining options (from Chipotle and Hot Dog on a Stick to Benihans and Cheesecake Factory), and with the largest Forever 21 my daughter had ever seen.

In general, this was a budget place, but it had more character than the average budget option.  The grounds were nicer than most budget motels, with a waterfall which could be viewed from the pool, grassy areas, a gazebo, and even a little manicured garden.  Strangely, the "jacuzzi" was intentionally cold water. The complimentary breakfast was pretty comprehensive, with cereal, milk, oatmeal (instant, with hot water and a microwave), OJ, toast (yourself) and jam, fresh fruit (cantaloupe and honeydew melon), coffee, tea (with hot water), cocoa mix, etc. in a breakfast room off the lobby. The staff was super friendly and hardworking (particularly the woman working the breakfast area and the housekeeper).  And the room itself very spacious, with high ceilings.
That said, there was definitely room for improvement. Safety and security were an issue.  The upstairs balconies are shared with the room next door, so your neighbors can walk out their sliding glass door and peer into your room because the shutters and curtains do not completely block the view.  The room door didn't have a security latch to lock the door from the inside.  In looking for somewhere to plug in my phone, I discovered that one electrical outlet had one of those ancient, cheap multi-plugs with the TV, dorm 'fridge and two lamps all sharing one outlet (looked like a fire hazard waiting to happen). There is a lip between the outdoor hallway and the room, which I tripped over numerous times, and stairs to the parking lot didn't have handrails. The was definitely some deferred maintenance.  The dorm 'fridge in the room had one foot missing, so you had to brace it to open it (or it started to fall out of the cabinet when you pulled the door).  The room itself looked spotless, but the carpet was so dirty that our socks became black while walking across it.  One of the ice machines was broken.
It is also important for light sleepers (like me) to know that it's noisy, there really isn't an option for a quiet room.  This property is surrounded on three sides by busy streets, with a hospital located on one of them.  So in addition to traffic noise, there was a steady stream of emergency vehicles with sirens blaring all day and all night.  In addition, there is a building that houses some system that vented to the parking lot and created quite a loud blowing noise. Because the windows in the bathroom were louvered, they didn't block outside noise well.

data.title: Nice grounds- lousy Hotel.
data.text:
A while ago I pass by this Hotel and the grounds looks so pretty that I wanted to stay here and finally I did..... But boy........ What a desappoinment !!!!!! ...... IT REALLY NEEDS SOME TLC!!!!
They told me that I had being upgraded compliments of the Hotel...... That was BAD.... Really bad, the bathtub had a lot bugs, the shower head really needs to be replace is has water stains, and the room really needs to be upgraded is in really bad condition, I think giving it a two stars is being very generous from my part, they change me to another room but it also had a bug in the bathroom, I have seeing this king of bugs in old structures. And not to mention the TV ....... Besides being small, the picture was horrible that I decided to turn it off and read a book. Don't forget this place do not offer complementary Wi-Fi.
It is my humble opinion and thank God I only stayed two nights.

data.title: It was fitting we went to see ant-man that night
data.text: This hotel was not as advertised. Floor was sticky. Bathroom was in a state of decay. The biggest problem was that we left for 3 hours and came back to a bathroom full of ants. We called the front desk and they quickly came in with ant spray, which was nice. Beds were fairly comfortable. Still, the tripadvisor average did not remotely match our experience.

data.title: Basic hotel across from the Santa Anita Racetrack
data.text:
The hotel is open air access to outside from your room. I believe the value is great, as this is a business trip pay for by the company, the travel web sites are about $80/night during that time.
It is directly across the Santa Anita Racetrack and about 2 blocks to the Arcadia city park. On site they do weddings and it appears like it is always in progress of remodeling because sections were closed off. 
There is nothing fancy about the hotel, everything is very basic in the room, though very nice size. A lot of the hardware are either old, broken or needs repair (example: bathroom sink/handle). I can't say it makes you feel they are putting a lot of maintenance efforts, at least for the room I was staying in. My room was quite.
There is a pool that looks well maintained.
No on site restaurant, continental breakfast is included (no hot food or eggs). This is good if you would like to get something simple to start the day. 
Within short walking distance is the Arcadia park that is the size of the entire block. Many local residents are there at night, so if you would like to go for a stroll, this is a great location.
There is also a mall close by, but not within walking distance (>1-2 mile).
I would say this is a very basic hotel/motel and if there are races at the racetrack, I can see it sold out. But as far as amenities, though they do host weddings, it is still pretty basic. You can see this once you arrive on site of the overall feel.

data.title: Great Disappointment, Room was digraceful
data.text:
Our family checked into this place for two days. Parked in front of building where our room was, saw construction. Rooms below and next to ours were in heavy renovation.  (First negative clue)  As soon as we opened the door we had a Strong insecticide smell. Then as we are in the room saw an extension cord running from one side of the room to the other.  This was giving power to the tv,micro, fridge, lights, alarm clock and our cell phones when charging. Called front desk lady to tell her how badly the room smelled, was told that Fridays were exterminator days, the patio was sprayed. Odd, since leaving the sliding glass door open, even though there was no screen,  and the window of the patio let the stink out, not in.  Finally went down to desk to see if switching rooms wold be an option. Was told by same lady on duty who checked us in less than 1 hour prior, we could not switch since the beds were used. Strange thing to say since my husband, myself, and children do not sleep at that time of the afternoon, and we barely finished walking our things up to 2nd floor room. (Children are way past nap taking age) She did offer deodorizer, declined, thinking why add another smell??  Shower rod randomly kept falling.  The screen for window was not properly installed, big 1 to 3 inch gap in some places.
Went down one evening to talk to front desk a question, after standing unnoticed for several minutes, the man made a sort of whistling noise to get my attention. Very disrespectful! Could not in any way stay here again.

data.title: What a find.
data.text: This hotel is fantastic.  The room is huge, balcony overlooks the beautiful gardens.  The pool area is really good.  Some great restos within minutes walking.  Try the Korean one in same street, was lovely.  Service was great also.  Bed comfy and all linen clean and crisp.  Walking distance to the racetrack which we will go to today.  Definitely recommend

data.title: apartments in a beautiful setting
data.text: I was very surprised when we arrived at the santa anita the staff are very helpful and the location is second to none it sits in the foothills of the mountains and is located right next door to the famous Santa anita park horse racing track the rooms,or at least the ones I stayed in are pretty basic although if you ask for better equipped rooms they can be made available the suites ...which all the rooms are, are located around nice grounds and carefully manicured green spaces there is also a swimming pool with jaccuzi and water fall....there are also cooking and washing facilities on the blocks of apartments and the rates are good.

data.title: Best location for a visit to the horse races at Santa Anita
data.text: This hotel is a very nice, if a bit dated, hotel.  Very comfortable and homey.  It definitely seems to have some history and we enjoyed our stay very much.  Would definitely stay here again.  Location is great with Santa Anita Racetrack just across the street.

data.title: The best get away ever for my family.
data.text: My husband and I wanted just a little getaway for a couple days that was safe and clean for our 3 yr old twins.We found this place and booked it without obligation no credit card needed. We went to see it the day before we were to arrive and the staff was wonderful let us in the room  . The grounds are beautiful u all out ur balcony you see squirrels running around its clean. Rooms clean extra towels, breakfast was nice, rates are okay. And very safe and quite. My only complaint would be the cable could be better. We will and have planned to return at least once a month.

data.title: Good for a short visit
data.text: We stayed here for just one night, which was fine.  It was quiet, and the grounds are beautiful. The rooms, although clean, are very dated (I wouldn't be surprised to find the same television on display in the Smithsonian).  The bed was pretty comfortable.  The swimming pool area is awesome!  There is a fairly large waterfall next to the hot tub/pool that is so, so relaxing.  We had an hour to kill before a dinner date, which we spent sitting poolside, listening to the waterfall.  All-in-all, I think the Santa Anita Inn is great for a short visit; I would probably not stay more than two nights.  And you cannot beat the price!

data.title: Front desk could not have been nicer.
data.text: Great location. Right across the street from Santa Anita Race Track. The room is large. , clean and older. No complaints at all. Woman at the front desk was delightful. She was sweet and accommodating.

data.title: what a great view in the morning!
data.text: Looked out the window and saw the horses being put thru their paces.... nice continental breakfast.... and the gardens were fabulous! We were able to walk right across the street to the race track....
